website_summaries.verdict: Powerful 1.75 horsepower motor allows router to reach high speeds for very precise results.
pros: Router reaches a speed up to 27,500 revolutions per minute, an excellent performance level for a handheld router
Very good quality of aluminum motor housing and base
Unit's collet can handle multiple depths of shank bits
Provides bit depth accuracy to within 1/128th of an inch
cons: Price is a little higher than some others

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Good router, easy to adjust height. These run very hot if you use it for a long time; ours go all day 5 days a week, we always have 6 in service. Great for the price, our lifespan for these is about 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Deadley

customer_reviews.title: Aging design lacking refinements of today's routers
customer_reviews.text: Lacks serious refinement when compared to a Bosch router. Lack of speed control, lots of vibration and noise on startup and when running. Returned because of those issues and went with the Bosch, albeit for more $ and a slightly larger/heavier (but more powerful) router.
customer_reviews.author: Stinkysquishy

customer_reviews.title: P-C 690
customer_reviews.text: This is a rock solid performer. I have four P-C routers in my shop. I manufacture wood furniture and cabinetry every day. This router is simple and straight forward, no gadgets. (I have had other router makes, but they don't stand the test of time). The P-C routers need two wrenches to change router bits, instead of a shaft lock. Shaft locks wear and require some way to grip the router body to either tighten or untighten the collet. This twists the router shaft unduly. Two wrenches will securely tighten the bit in the collet without twisting the router shaft. The P-C 690 is a long wearing, reliable product and represents a great value. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great router at a fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: You can hardly go wrong with Porter Cable equipment. I was almost happy when my old Bosch router had an unglamorous death right in the middle of a project. I was very happy with the price here and SUPER happy with the fast shipping. Once I started using the router I realized what a piece of junk my old router was. The PC runs smoothly and so far plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: New models not up to old standards
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 of these units over the last 20 years. They seemed to last and last until the final two I purchased last year. The armatures went out with in a year on both of them. The quality of the winding must be way cheapened from the old ones that have kept going with a simple brush replacement. I will be looking at other brands for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hachmann

customer_reviews.title: The original of the species router
customer_reviews.text: The original of the species. Solid powerful router with simple on-off switch easy to adjust solid base that is compatible with guides etc. You can buy plunge bases to fit the same model. Basically a perfect machine. Nothing fancy. Therefore nothing fancy to break. No play at all which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas O' Grady

customer_reviews.title: Easy to repair
customer_reviews.text: Have several of these. Use them with the PC Dovetail Jig. Set each one up for something different. Tails or pins. Don't have to change settings. Light weight and basic. Nothing fancy. Also own Hitachi 3hp plunge router and an old Craftsman. Price is right and they are fairly bullet proof. Easy to repair. For the home hobbyist this will 99.99% of the time suit your needs. PC accessories fit with out any special mods or plates. If you buy the PC dovetail jig should pick up two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: There's a little bit of a learning curve to set depths and other adjustments, but overall and so far, this router has lived up to it's higher reviews here and elsewhere on the Internet. Because of it's high rpm and power, It's now my go-to router for most projects.
customer_reviews.author: jaybee

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for just under three years now and it completely stopped working. I inspected the brushes and they had plenty of life left. Porter cable had me send it to a service center and they determined that its not under warranty! I’m still waiting to hear what it’ll cost to repair. Their three year warranty is junk and this router didn’t even last three years of light to medium work so I wouldn’t buy it again nor would I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: A Classic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work of art and has been in production for many years. I wasn't happy that the seller just slapped a label on the retail package but it did survive the trip. I'm not fond of those rocker power switches that take a minute to feel one's way to but what can you do.
customer_reviews.author: A. Paprocki

customer_reviews.title: Porter Cables best offering.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this item for the price, the best item Porter Cable Makes. Every company makes one tool in their line that seems better than everyone else's, For Hitachi it's Nail Guns, Bosch it's their Jig Saw, Skil it's there Worm drive, and Don't Forget Milwaukie and their Drills , but this Is where Porter Cable shines !
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: Amazed because now price is double.
customer_reviews.text: Price was $109.00 on December 2012. Normally Porter Cable is reliable and you get a little more for the price. I recommend the product but now is so expensive considering the price in 2012.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Does most routing jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, basic router. Unless you do a lot of routing this will handle most everything you need and Porter Cable is the best brand in routers (IMHO). That said I do have one complaint about it. The base it comes with has a narrow opening. As such when routing certain large diameter bits one may not be able to set the cut to shallow depth. This has been a problem for me with some rabbiting I was doing. I was able to work around it but it would be nice if it came with maybe two base plates to help with this.. However it is one of the least expensive routers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on tickin'
customer_reviews.text: I can find absolutely nothing wrong with this router. It's probably run for a few hundred hours in the last two years, and seems as good as new. Does exactly what it's supposed to, and does it well. When it dies, I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Josko A. Catipovic

customer_reviews.title: 690 Review
customer_reviews.text: The 690 was my first router that I bought years ago. I now own and use several, the one from amazon is the latest. I like have multiple routers each configured for a special task and the 690 is perfect for that. Has enough power for most woodworking jobs yet it is light and easy to use. I have one mounted in a Bench Dog portable router tableand the others live in D-handle baseswhich are much better that the fixed base. Theses routers have worked and done everything I asked of them. Though they lack some of the finer features they are just a good solid reliable router workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Venable

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to act as the cutting spindle on the CNC table I've built. Thanks to the 27,000rpm fixed speed, this is the perfect cutting tool for me! The high quality shaft/bearings has created an incredibly low tolerance which is exactly perfect for my usage. Though rated for 11-amp, I find that in most materials it never exceeds 4 or 5. WIth the help of my CNC, this router has sliced its way though mdf, solid-oak, nylon and 1/16" brass. This is a fantastic router and if you have any use for one, BUY THIS ONE! The warranty and quality are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Colley

customer_reviews.title: Great Mid-Size Router
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 30+ year old Rockwell with PC 690LR. Plenty of power and easy to adjust/change bits. The flat top is a great feature for setting down when needed. Again, you can't go wrong with PC hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Matthews

customer_reviews.title: strong machine
customer_reviews.text: The Porter-Cable 690LR 11 router is a very durable and long lasting router. Handles 1/4 inch and 1/2 inch router bits. I made exterior railings, posts and other items for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanene K.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality router
customer_reviews.text: I have a router table with a Rockler lift, and needed a router body, with three brands/models usable in the lift. I priced the motors individually from Amazon.com, Homedepot.com and Lowes.com. The final result was this complete router was cheaper on Amazon.com than buying the motor alone. The base will be tossed, since the motor will be permanently installed in the table/lift. This router is the quality I'd expect from Porter-Cable.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Sly

customer_reviews.title: The old Standard
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years. No extraneous crap, durable, and the lever lock that replaces the old thumb screw on the base is a welcomed upgrade. I'm glad (and a little surprised) that Porter Cable hasn't modernized/cheapened/upgraded/colorized/fixed-what-ain't-broke/digitized/computerized or discontinued this router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable 11 amp Fixed-Base Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my husband. He was very happy with this router. It is right for the jobs he does at home.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast and will cut through anything. Great product and adjustability
customer_reviews.author: Coopersticious

customer_reviews.title: well made.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router after my sears one locked up on me. That is why I bought this one, you need to seperate the motor to change the bits, so I can clean it, and it will not lock up. The reason I did not give it 5 stars is the issue with the plate at the bottom, and not being able to use a 1/2' bit. I wish they would have rectified this when making the product. I have an older router I use for this person, rather than spending another $20 for a different plate.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Beastly
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older Bosch. I won't review beyond saying all the positive comments are accurate. I have about 16 hours of run time on this with zero complaints. Mine is mounted in a Jessem lift in a dedicated table.
customer_reviews.author: JD4537

customer_reviews.title: You won't beat this performance at this price!
customer_reviews.text: If you are an intermediate or beginning wood worker, then this is the router for you. I love it. It works very well. I have never noticed any play in the collett. Adjustment is very easy. I have mounted mine under my router table. It is compatible with every jig and accessory that I have ever purchased. Very well rounded tool. If you have an extra $90, go for the set that includes the plunge base. Not getting that is my only regret.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Kid

customer_reviews.title: Very good router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice router. It has plenty of power to turn 1/2" bits. The base plate has the cutout for an adapter to cut dovetail.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: Handles both 1/4 and 1/2 inch router bits
customer_reviews.text: I have several routers and I got this one to work with a router jig that allows adjusting from the top as well as changing bits from the top. As a router it does exactly what it should but I really like the fact that it can handle both 1/4 inch and 1/2 inch router bits. It's the only one I have that does this. With its power, I can use it in a shaper mode also.
customer_reviews.author: VaughnFromUtah

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value, but hard to use on a router table. The cord does not detach and it spins as you move the bit up and down. So the cord and switch are always in a different (and usually inconvenient place). Good for us off the table. Adequate power.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: The second Porter-Cable 690 I own.I have had the first one at least 20 years (not hard use) really like this item. My first one stopped running at full power.When I received the new one I found the brushes were loose inside the older model and it is still running good!
customer_reviews.author: Don Wallen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to use a 20 year old router. This router made the job so much easier. It is a great router
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product great manufacture highly recommend everything from Porter cable
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for the average handyman
customer_reviews.text: Application: Home projects Pros: Cheap Sturdy Cons: Sold without router bits (this is nitpicking) Conclusion: Excellent tool for the average handyman at a great price
customer_reviews.author: M S Mc Cright

customer_reviews.title: Middling Model
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because of Porter-Cable reputation and the attractive price. Have not used it long enough to judge its durability, but at this point am moderately satisfied: not bad, but not distinguishably good, either. Pleasing attributes: adequate power and accuracy. Annoyances: base plate opening diameter too small for many bits, bit changing comparatively laborious, soft switch response fussy. The 690LR model seems middling -- better than some other brands at lower prices, not up to other Porter-Cable cable models or other brands at higher prices. Check other reviews for extended use quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Blaker

customer_reviews.title: replaced my 15 year old one it seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: replaced my 15 year old one it seems to be the same even after all these years ( I tend to use a lam. router for as most for my work, but use the collar for hinge work) )
customer_reviews.author: ward

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Porter Cable makes good tools. This is my second router made by them.
customer_reviews.author: Nolfe

customer_reviews.title: Best Router Made
customer_reviews.text: My old Porter Cable Router was made in the USA. The new one that arrived a couple of weeks ago was made in Mexico. To my surprise the Mexican made router is just as good as my old USA built router. If it had indicated "Made in China", then I would have sent it back. This router is up to Porter Cable standards and comes with the correct size opening that accepts standard size bushings. Other routers have odd size openings that do not accept a standard bushing. I highly recommend this router to any woodworker that requires a good dependable router.
customer_reviews.author: John Long

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Router for the Price. Smooth running.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Router for the Price. It runs smooth, the balance is very good and it is not very heavy for it's size and power. Also, it was $40.00 cheaper than the same tool at our locate hardware store. With free shipping, it was a outstanding price. I always check Amazon first before buying anything. Most times it is cheaper, including books, and with the free shipping for purchase on most items over a set price, it is a outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Ethridge

customer_reviews.title: Good second router
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a second router for dove tails cuts to use with PC 4216 Jig. Good it is easy to use with templates from the jig set as it is Porter-Cable made. Worth the money for sure
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Ignatov

customer_reviews.title: whar can you say? It's a Porter-Cable. This ...
customer_reviews.text: whar can you say? It's a Porter-Cable. This is a long standing workhorse in many wood shops. I have used this and others of this model for years. Very well made and works well in my router table.
customer_reviews.author: George Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Cute Router
customer_reviews.text: I like this router, it's powerful and accurate. But the 1/2" collet is very tight, I'm not sure if it is designed that way. The position of the power switch is badly designed. I wish there were longer screws provided for easier table mounting; I had to go to HomeDepot to search for 30 minutes for the correct screws. No tool provided for taking off the two handles, I just happen to have it (an unusually huge Allen Wrench).
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: A complete routher for lerss than the motor alone.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent value, since Porter Cable sells just the motor about $15 more. The lever base is quick and secure. I don't have to change the motor from my first 690 kit in and out of the router table it now lives in.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nasser

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came with a case, but it's a solid tool for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Had to get this to use the Porter Cable Dovetail jig because the Bosch router needed two additional parts to be able to hold the template bushing which is just asking to lose things. This router is only OK because there's no case included for it, otherwise it would be 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lukas Blakk

customer_reviews.title: verygood
customer_reviews.text: i have been using it for years now works well
customer_reviews.author: Carl Schomberg

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN THE USA ANYMORE!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Porter Cable 690. The first still runs good, I just needed a second for a special project . my first was made in Tennessee. My second(and last) was made in Mexico. No more Porter cable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ian R.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: been using this model for 20 years works and lasts well! I have bought 3 over the years and work them in a cabinet shop and they get a lot of use!Good router
customer_reviews.author: Herman harrison

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, it is versatile, reliable and user-friendly for the basic beginner/intermediate woodworker. If you find it bewildering shopping for routers and are somewhat intimidated by them, this is the one you want. This is your basic no-bugs, do-everything basic unit that sets you up to get a plunge base, fit into a router table, use dovetail jigs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Dulin

customer_reviews.title: Great router, good price
customer_reviews.text: This router is awesome! I am hooked on buying tools via Amazon because I got a real Porter Cable router for a great price. The router is solid, has worked perfectly for me thus far, and is really smooth. You can tell it's a quality tool just by the sound of it and the silky feel. Really, nothing else to report, and I think that's how it should be for a tool like a router. It just works every time, plain and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moyers

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! However the box it came in did not close well and I had to improvise in order to close it. Also it did not come with the collets to hold the bits.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Same quality same product cheaper price than the large chain ...
customer_reviews.text: Same quality same product cheaper price than the large chain stores.
customer_reviews.author: postie

customer_reviews.title: Great!.
customer_reviews.text: Great !...I had 5 old doors to replace and I needed it to rout out slots for hinges on the new ones. Job done in no time !
customer_reviews.author: CLIFF

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This router works well and is well balanced to work with a dovetail jig.
customer_reviews.author: dennis sanders

customer_reviews.title: Nice router for any shop
customer_reviews.text: Absolute Porter-Cable quality one would expect! Nice router for any shop.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Rowinsky

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Great router as I now have two of them. One for my router table and one for my router templates so I do not have to change routers all the time once the router is setup. The router is well built and runs smooth. Porter Cable is top quality in tools.
customer_reviews.author: David Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Just when you think they couldn't make it better, they did
customer_reviews.text: Just when you think they couldn't make it better, they did. This one is replacing a 13 year old router, and its pretty much the same thing, but with more horsepower. Depth adjustments are great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: one of the best tools made, and at a good price too.
customer_reviews.text: can't go wrong with the old reliable 690. i've used these same routers for years, and the have always performed great. it's one of the best tools. own. right up there with the milwaukee reciprocating saw. it's a real work horse.
customer_reviews.author: captainmalibu

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Sturdy. Used it at school and fell in love. It's small and works well for me because I'm a small person. Changing depths is fast with just a quick flip of the lock, a twist, and depth check with a small combination square.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've only used it with the dovetail jig but it's easy to adjust and easy to change bits
customer_reviews.text: So far, this router has performed very well. I've only used it with the dovetail jig but it's easy to adjust and easy to change bits. It's a great advantage that it comes with both a 1/4" and 1/2" collets.
customer_reviews.author: BugKnuckle

customer_reviews.title: Router good
customer_reviews.text: Router works great, but the switch placement makes you think the person who designed this router never tried to use it. Otherwise, it works great. Used a foot switch for dovetailing, that is a good setup.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Fuseler

customer_reviews.title: Rugged.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this router for our cabinet shop. We have had several over the years and they last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance router.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these routers over the past few years and it is a very good router. We are hard on our tools and it performs great. That's why I come back to it when my guys kill them.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L. Fike

customer_reviews.title: Tough to beat
customer_reviews.text: These routers are exceptional, I put a rabbet bit in it to test it out cutting 3/4 in and 1/2 deep and it didn't miss a beat cuts nice. The precision of the base is insane as well, 1/128th of an inch?!?!?!? way more accurate than i will ever need. You wont find a better router for the price and quite possible wont find one for more.
customer_reviews.author: rjm

customer_reviews.title: This is still nice though.
customer_reviews.text: It's a PC 690 router. If you ended up here, you already know why and how. Just wait for a sale. But if you can get the variable speed model, get that one. This is still nice though.
customer_reviews.author: God

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my Porter Cable dovetail jig. Of course it works great with that, but this is a solid and nice router at a great price. On Prime, I saved several bucks over the local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas at his request. I own three Porter Cable routers and they all work great. I have yet to be disappointed. The very first Porter-Cable router I bought was 16 years ago and it is out in my shop and is still used frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great router! Power a plenty
customer_reviews.text: Great router! Power a plenty, easily change bits, long cord! The only way to take the fun out of having one of these, is not having something to build!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID HAMLETT

customer_reviews.title: Great no-frills router
customer_reviews.text: I needed a couple of routers to go with my Leigh dovetail jig and these were the most inexpensive good name routers I could find. I bought 2 of them and set one up for tails and one for pins and just leave them set up for that one task. They perform flawlessly and now I can just grab them and know they will give me a perfect joint every time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mcquay

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great basic no-frills router but bit height adjustment is a bit crude.
customer_reviews.author: Al Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: great product and easy to use, haven't bogged it down yet, made/replaced all of the window sills, and replaced the shoe molding in the entire house. Although I originally wanted the Bosch Router, I went for this one due to cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walck

customer_reviews.title: I received this item promptly and my husband was very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. I received this item promptly and my husband was very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Christy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, runs well and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: A Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I am just a hobbist but I think the PC 690LR is a fine little router and a lot of people are making a big deal out of having to use two wrenchs to change bits I personaly have no issues with this, and also some are complaining about the switch placement if you can't hold it with one hand you start it because it don't have soft start, then you probably should'nt be using a router, in my humble opinion it really don't torque enough to pull it out of your hand. and Amazon was right on time with their delivery, as a matter of fact they were one day early on their delivery date.
customer_reviews.author: CV.

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: If a beaver could could chuck wood as fast as thing can eat through it we would need to do some serious tree planting to keep forest from extinction. Truly a powerful tool that does exactly what it needs to. Its improved my ability to router 10 fold.
customer_reviews.author: Megan West

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable 690LR
customer_reviews.text: The only way to improve on perfection, is to add more power. There is alot of quality built in to this router. It is light wieght and easy to handle. It will accomadate all of your bits with it's easy to change 1/2 and 1/4 collets. I am buying a second one. The first is mounted in my router table and the second will be for free hand. The new lever release allows for perfect bit hieght adjustments. I own about 5 different routers, the only one's I am keeping are my Porter Cables. The track record speaks for itself. I also own the Porter-Cable 7529, 2HP, 5-Speed Plunge Router.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Hempel

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Porter Cable is still the undisputed king of routers. This router really delivers. I choose it because its the perfect size for a router table. I never did see the reason for buying a big honking 3 1/2 HP router for a router table. You cannot take off that much wood in a single pass so why all the extra power. This design works great for me and still does a great job without burning the wood. I use oak and maple a lot, so it really works well for me. I put this into a Bench Dog Router Table
customer_reviews.author: K. Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Well built properly powered router.
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy this router after buying PC dovetail jig. Reminds me of my old Craftsman router I had purchased in the 50's. Well built machine with plenty of power. Depth adjustment is somewhat tricky but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: regor428

customer_reviews.title: A very good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have bought. Once you get past the ordeal of using two wrenches to install your bit, it is easy and accurate to setup. The best however is when you turn it on, even with a large bit it runs smooth, no noticeable vibration. It maintains it's speed even in hardwoods. It is well balanced and easy to use. My dislikes are using the two wrenches (no biggy), not being able to see where your bit is cutting, need to get a clear base, and the inconsistent location of the power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Geater router
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I do a lot of routing and needed something that would hold up so I spent the extra money and bought this. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Rehmel

customer_reviews.title: Cuttin' up
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Easy to use and understand its usage. I am a beginner and have already prefected confidence and some skill. Perfect for the around the house jobs that I bought it for. Only bad thing is that I am filling the house with cool looking shelves and furniture. But I guess that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: John C Williams Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, they are basic but bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: mark orr

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable 690LR Router
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for several weeks now and used it lot since receiving it. I am very pleased. It is well built and when set to a certain depth, it stays there. I previously owned a Craftsman router that constantly slipped and changed the routing depth. The one advantage to the Craftsman was that it was lighter than the Porter-Cable. However, that was due to the fact that much of it was made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Flyfishing Padre

customer_reviews.title: I have three of these in my shop that get ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these in my shop that get used several times a day one is about 15 years old what can I say they last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to route dovetails. Plenty of power, cut through red oak like butter. Very pleased, great price for great router. Attached baseplate is the standard for guide bushings.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cranston

customer_reviews.title: None like it
customer_reviews.text: Had same model for years Used in framing constantly But it final burned up but liked it so we'll I wanted the exact model and so bought it It's a great tool
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my Purchase...
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that PC might have continued to cheapen up their tools. It turned out to be as good as tools purchased in the past. Delivery was excellent, price was good. Overall very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: djones

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Meets or exceeds the Companies expectations for a product frequently used in a production enviroment. This item was well priced for the valu.
customer_reviews.author: John Schettko

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 other routers. It appeared, by other reviews, that it works better with PC. The gimmick of adaptors turned me off. Glad I pulled the trigger. Actually bought another one at HD so I did not have to keep changing bits. Interesting point though, I paid 15.00 more from HD but it came with a case. The Amazon one came in a cardboard box. Don't know if I can get another case but I will try. These tools are worth taking care of.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R Superstar

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal! Works well
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to use. Has enough power to handle my routing needs. Changing bits is easy just open latch and turn motor housing to remove. I mounted this in my table and adjustments are simple to make. Great buy for a low cost router I was very happy and would recomend this to a friend as well as purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: kingami

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, 3rd 690 I have bought and all ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, 3rd 690 I have bought and all have been work horses. But hey Porter Cable, I miss the older version's toggle on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Good power and good depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Good power and good depth adjustment. I don't particularly care for the on/off switch - you have to take your hand off the handle while it is running to turn off the router
customer_reviews.author: Paladin71

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace my broken 20 yo PC router Still a winner
customer_reviews.author: R Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router so that I can leave it attached to my routed table and leave my other router free. My shop is used for making fine furniture as a hobby and I did not need a heavy duty machine. This one tots the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Albert B. Coltrane

customer_reviews.title: good router with minor drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: this is a good router but it does require two wrenches to change bits. A lock and one wrench system is better. You also have to really crank down on the depth lock screw or the depth tends to increase at times.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoftiezer

customer_reviews.title: Simple well designed router
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that delivers. It's simple design gets the job done. This is one of 3 routers I own and I find myself using this one more often than not.
customer_reviews.author: Radiant Simplicity

customer_reviews.title: Best router I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, and dependable router! has no problem working aluminum as well as wood!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Porter-Cable has been my choice for 25 years. Their routers are unsurpassed and durable.
customer_reviews.author: bowtye2

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, well made router. This is just like the one I taught students to use in my middle school wood shop. It is made in Mexico, but seems like the quality control is much better than the tools I have gotten from China. It is a real workhorse, you can't go wrong with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: George fotinakes

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I am a homeowner who dabbles in woodworking and felt I did not need the most powerful router on the market. What I wanted was a router that had been on the market for some time (indicating consumer approval and reliablity) and had a number of accessories available. This one fit my requirements. I have not regetted my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ag52

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router I own threw of them for my small ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router I own three of them for my small cabinet shop. I bought the latest one for one off my customers who wants to start doing woodworking. I think they're the best ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Djajc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice router
customer_reviews.text: Best thing out there! Porter Cable is the standard for routers and router accessories.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Fun

customer_reviews.title: Shop workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an additional router to go with my 690PK fixed/plunge router kit. I now keep my older router and base in the router table and use this router interchangeably with the plunge base. This newer version had a much easier to use locking mechanism and being able to switch over from 1/4" to 1/2" collets is a big plus. This model has been a workhorse in my shop for many years now. While it doesn't have all the bells and whistles some newer models have, (reason for only 4 stars) I consider those "bells and whistles" to be mostly superfluous. Thus, this is a good router to have handy.
customer_reviews.author: Zapato

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE Router, Fixed Base, 11-Amp (690LR)
product_meta.description:
Style:RouterAmazon.com Powerful and efficient, the Porter-Cable 690LR fixed-base router utilizes a hefty 1-3/4-horsepower motor to generate an impressive 27,500 revolutions-per-minute for precise cuts. Two ergonomic handles are strategically placed to make routing easy and comfortable, even during all-day jobs. For added convenience, the router includes collets that will accept 1/4-inch and 1/2-inch shank bits. 690LR Fixed-Base Router At a Glance: Single-speed router with 1-3/4-horsepower motor generates 27,500 rpm for easy routing Fast, precise coarse adjustments via spiral can design and cam-lock lever Auto-release collet system for easy bit removal Three-year warranty 1-3/4-horsepower router makes precision cuts in a wide variety of woods. View larger. Powerful and Precise An essential addition to any woodworking shop, the router owes its robust performance to a single-speed, 11-amp motor that produces 1-3/4 peak horsepower to handle a range of jobs. For consistent, steady performance, the cam-lock lever enables simple coarse height adjustments. A quick fixed-base motor release allows the user to move the motor pack between plunge and d-handle bases (each sold separately). Accurate to within 1/128 inch, a micro depth adjustor ensures optimum precision. Rugged Construction with Dust-Sealed Components As durable as it is efficient, the router features a precision-machined aluminum motor housing and base. A dust-sealed switch and sealed ball-bearing construction guard against wear and tear--even in a hardworking shop or busy jobsite. Fast Bit Removal and Ergonomic Design for Stability and Comfort For user-friendly performance and consistency, the router includes an auto-release collet system for easy bit removal. An under-table stop prevents the motor from inadvertently rotating out of the base, and ergonomic molded grips keep your hands and wrists comfortable, even during extended jobs. Dimensions and Warranty

AMAZON.COM
Powerful and efficient, the Porter-Cable 690LR fixed-base router utilizes a hefty 1-3/4-horsepower motor to generate an impressive 27,500 revolutions-per-minute for precise cuts. Two ergonomic handles are strategically placed to make routing easy and comfortable, even during all-day jobs. For added convenience, the router includes collets that will accept 1/4-inch and 1/2-inch shank bits.



690LR Fixed-Base Router
At a Glance: * Single-speed router with
   1-3/4-horsepower motor generates 27,500 rpm for easy routing
   
   
 * Fast, precise coarse adjustments via spiral can design and cam-lock lever
   
   
 * Auto-release collet system for easy bit removal
   
   
 * Three-year warranty


1-3/4-horsepower router makes precision cuts in a wide variety of woods. View larger.Powerful and Precise
An essential addition to any woodworking shop, the router owes its robust performance to a single-speed, 11-amp motor that produces 1-3/4 peak horsepower to handle a range of jobs. For consistent, steady performance, the cam-lock lever enables simple coarse height adjustments. A quick fixed-base motor release allows th user to move the motor pack between plunge and d-handle bases (each sold seperately). Accurate to within 1/128 inch, a micro depth adjustor ensures optimum precision.Rugged Construction with Dust-Sealed Components
As durable as it is efficient, the router features a precision-machined aluminum motor housing and base. A dust-sealed switch and sealed ball-bearing construction guard against wear and tear--even in a hardworking shop or busy jobsite.

Fast Bit Removal and Ergonomic Design for Stability and Comfort
For user-friendly performance and consistency, the router includes an auto-release collet system for easy bit removal. An under-table stop prevents the motor from inadvertantly rotating out of the base, and ergonomic molded grips keep your hands and wrists comfortable, even during extended jobs.

Dimensions and Warranty Information
The 690LR Fixed-Base Router measures 12.0 by 5.50 by 8.62 inches (L x W x H), weighs 8.0 pounds, and is backed by a three-year limited warranty, a one-year free service contract, and 90 day money back guarantee.

What's in the Box
Router with motor, fixed base, 1/4-inch and 1/2-inch collets, collet wrench, and operating manual.





Aluminum motor housing and base
for stability during operation. 
Auto-release collet system
for easy bit removal.
